009package imagingbook.common.geometry.fitting.line;
010
011import static imagingbook.common.math.Arithmetic.sqr;
012
013import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.MatrixUtils;
014
015import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Pnt2d;
016import imagingbook.common.math.eigen.EigenDecompositionJama;
017import imagingbook.common.util.SortMap;
018
019/**
020 * <p>
021 * This class implements line fitting by orthogonal regression to a set of 2D
022 * points using eigendecomposition. See Sec. 10.2.2 (Alg. 10.1) of [1] for
023 * additional details.
024 * </p>
025 * <p>
026 * [1] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing &ndash; An Algorithmic
027 * Introduction</em>, 3rd ed, Springer (2022).
028 * </p>
029 * 
030 * @author WB
031 * @version 2022/09/29
032 * 
033 * @see OrthogonalLineFitSvd
034 * @see OrthogonalLineFitHomogeneous
035 */
036public class OrthogonalLineFitEigen implements LineFit {
037        
038        private final int n;
039        private final double[] p;       // algebraic line parameters A,B,C
040        
041        /**
042         * Constructor, performs a orthogonal regression fit to the specified points.
043         * At least two different points are required.
044         * 
045         * @param points an array with at least 2 points
046         */
047        public OrthogonalLineFitEigen(Pnt2d[] points) {
048                if (points.length < 2) {
049                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("line fit requires at least 2 points");
050                }
051                this.n = points.length;
052                this.p = fit(points);
053        }
054        
055        @Override
056        public int getSize() {
057                return n;
058        }
059
060        @Override
061        public double[] getLineParameters() {
062                return p;
063        }
064        
065        private double[] fit(Pnt2d[] points) {
066                final int n = points.length;
067        
068                double Sx = 0, Sy = 0, Sxx = 0, Syy = 0, Sxy = 0;
069                
070                for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
071                        final double x = points[i].getX();
072                        final double y = points[i].getY();
073                        Sx += x;
074                        Sy += y;
075                        Sxx += sqr(x);
076                        Syy += sqr(y);
077                        Sxy += x * y;
078                }
079                
080                double sxx = Sxx - sqr(Sx) / n;
081                double syy = Syy - sqr(Sy) / n;
082                double sxy = Sxy - Sx * Sy / n;
083                
084                double[][] S = {
085                                {sxx, sxy},
086                                {sxy, syy} 
087                };
088                
089                
090                EigenDecompositionJama es = new EigenDecompositionJama(MatrixUtils.createRealMatrix(S));        // Jama-derived local implementation
091//              EigenDecomposition es = new EigenDecomposition(MatrixUtils.createRealMatrix(S));        // Apache Commons Maths
092                int k = SortMap.getNthSmallestIndex(es.getRealEigenvalues(), 0);
093                double[] e = es.getEigenvector(k).toArray();
094                
095                double A = e[0];
096                double B = e[1];
097                double C = -(A * Sx + B * Sy) / n;
098                
099                return new double[] {A, B, C};
100        }
101}
